comment: This is the worst class I have taken to date. You only have two tests, and each one is 25% of your grade. Each one covers 10 chapters. She provides a study guide that is useless. Does not curve grades. There is a weekly discussion you can expect to spend lots of time on. Group project was fine. I would avoid this professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Overall great class, test are from book, group projects are a little crazy but can be fun, she is a very quicker responder and makes herself available to everyone. I would highly recommend
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: She's pretty good, but class material and content is so difficult. If you mess up once, you might as well mess up the entire class. Weekly discussions, smartbooks, etc., two hard tests, one group project.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Professors class consists of McGraw hill activities, two rough exams that are lockdown with camera, and weekly discussion posts. The tests are my main complaint because it is four essays along with 40+mc questions. study guide given didn't help too much, everything from book is fair game and each test contains ten chapters worth of stuff

Perfect online professor. Everything is clearly dated/organized for you to succeed. Graded on group project, weekly discussions, midterm, and final. She was easy to reach and communicate too. Good thing about a group project is you get to grade the others you worked with to make sure everyone did their fair share. Take her for an easy online course
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Super easy, just discussion posts weekly, smartbooks, and two tests. She is super attentive and will respond to anything quickly. She is the perfect online prof. Super organized and you can work at your own pace aside from the discussions being posted weekly. If you need to take an online class, I would definitely recommend her.

Average class. Discussions&smartbooks are the only assignments. discussions are weekly and 8 smartbooks are due before midterm, 8 due after. I would not advise doing those last minute because each one is like an hour long. And you have some group project activities but it is very easy if you get a big group. It includes interviewing professionals.

Great professor! Discussion posts feel more like research papers than opinion-based but it was the only hard assignment about the class. Connect assignments and exams. Says open book is not allowed but there is no lockdown. Group project topic is first-come-first-serve but it is easy to do if you get a good topic.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Took this online. Textbook and Smartbooks (19 total) are on Connect. Midterm & final exam. Weekly discussion posts which consists of MANY questions. One week was about 13 questions, these are more like mini essays and take up a lot of time. Group project which is poorly described - last three discussion posts ties together with the group project.

You have a group project, weekly discussions, chapter quizzes (google helps), a midterm, and a final. She is very direct and straight to the point. Sometimes I felt like I was in a lecture class scene from a movie just from the way she talks and teaches. She will ake you think, but you will learn a lot from her. She is overall a great professor.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Took this class as a hybrid course. There are weekly discussion posts that they are very long and count for a lot of your overall grade. The material is kind of hard to grasp. Midterm and Final Exam are essay questions only. Textbook not needed but you have do have to watch movies outside of class.

The hardest part is keeping up with discussions but if you just do them you'll be ok. She will call on you to talk in class but I got through it. I have respect for her, she doesn't care if you have a different political view than her. I lean pretty far left and she seemed to like all my discussions. The class is hard, but I enjoyed it a lot!

Most valuable class I have had in my college career, taught by and extremely passionate and educated woman. Lecture heavy with very time cosuming disscussions every week, but worth the time. Two written tests and a group project also make up your grade. Go into the class wanting to learn from her, and you will make the grade you want. Please take!

Passionate professor who wants to see her students change the world. Very lecture/discussion heavy. Participation matters. Online discussion posts due every week. 2 written exams. Chapter quizzes. Really interesting class. I learned a lot.
Good enough teacher, class wasn't too difficult. The Learnsmart modules take forever, and the group project was easy enough.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Zero lectures for the online class, the group project is poorly described. Little to zero directions on any of the assignments and the group project is a joke.

A hybrid class, 25% discussions easy grading just do it in time. Mid-term and final 20% each, easy if you study the study guide lots of writing on the exams. 25% group project not to bad, 10% online quizzes easy. She is very nice and want people to discuss topics in class. Just do everything in time and you will make a good grade.

Fantastic Professor. Truly cares about the future of her students. She is flexible with tests, and class attendance(given you can provide an adequate reason for missing particular dates). Lectures are more like discussions. At the beginning you may be nervous but in the end your itching to respond to people. There are online discussions every week.

This class is not one that you will sit in, look at slides all day, and be bored out of your mind. It is very engaging and full of relevant discussion. No textbook is needed, just be prepared to give input on topics that relate to business as well as current events. Grading is made up of weekly online discussions, 3 test, and a group presentation.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Prof. Smith is an MBA, and you can tell she is from the business world, not academia. She is very sharp and intelligent, and will keep you on your toes. 2 tests, 2 group presentations. Class time is filled with lively discussion and great guest speakers. I highly recommend this as an elective as long as you put your best foot forward.

Awful teacher! Very negative. Takes for ever to give you your graded assignments back. two group projects and one we had a week to do!! Test are four pages long, essay, short answer and some multiple choice. She barely teaches. She mostly has guest speakers and your forced to remember everything they say!! You have to teach yourself the whole book
